decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:
Heritage Statement, Reasonable Exemption Statement, P001 Rev A; P003 Rev A; P004 Rev B; P005 Rev B; P006 Rev A;  P010 Rev B; P011 Rev C; P013 Rev A P014 Rev B; P012 Rev A; Flood Risk Assessment (dated June 2022)                                                                                                               
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the approved plans, the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building. This shall include a Flemish brickwork bond to match the existing building, the use of matching brick and timber framed windows and doors. The development shall be retained in that form thereafter.  
REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policies DM1 and DM7 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 4 - Other that access for routine maintenance, the roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the approved plans, the development hereby permitted shall not be occupied, or brought into use until the new hedge using an evergreen species has been planted adjacent to the back parapet wall as shown on the approved drawings. The hedging shall be maintained and managed thereafter. 
REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
description: Single storey link attached side to rear extension with green roof (demolition of outbuildings)
